intro: Chrysocephalum ambiguum, commonly known as the golden everlasting or silverleaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers that bloom in spring and summer. The plant has narrow, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands. Chrysocephalum ambiguum is also valued for its ornamental use in gardens due to its long-lasting flowers and drought tolerance.
